thread.title: Probe into suspicious death in Tipperary continues as gardai do not release post-mortem report
thread.title_full: Probe into suspicious death in Tipperary continues as gardai do not release post-mortem report

author: VNExplorer
title: Probe into suspicious death in Tipperary continues as gardai do not release post-mortem report
text:
The house in which the man’s body was found.
Gardai have said they are still investigating the suspicious death of a man in rural Co Tipperary.
Officers said they were investigating all the circumstances of the man’s death in Ballycrana, near the village of Kilross on Wednesday.
A post mortem was carried out at University Hospital Waterford yesterday, but gardaí did not release any findings.
READ MORE – Little girl injured in Dublin crèche attack is out of danger and has even smiled, reveals loving mother
But sources say the man, who was a construction worker from eastern Europe, suffered serious head injuries at the house around five kilometres south west of Tipperary Town following a St Stephen’s night party there.
Emergency services found the man’s body in Kilross, close to the Limerick border, at around 4am on Wednesday.
It’s understood he had been socialising the previous night.
A spokeswoman appealed for anyone with information to contact gardaí.
She said: “Gardaí continue to investigate all the circumstances surrounding the discovery of a body of a man at a residence in Ballycrana, Kilross, County Tipperary, shortly after 4am yesterday, Wednesday 27th December 2023.
“The body was removed from the scene to the mortuary at University Hospital Waterford yesterday. A post-mortem examination has been completed today (Thursday 28th December 2023).
“The scene at Ballycrana remains preserved this evening.
“Gardaí continue to appeal to any person with any information that can assist with this investigation to contact Tipperary town Garda station on 062 80670, the Garda Confidential Line on 1800 666 111, or any Garda station.”
